From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
PageTitle: request platform software package install commit
FuncDef: To cancel the rollback timer and commit a software upgrade, use the **request platform software package install commit** command in privileged EXEC or diagnostic mode.
CLIs: request platform software package install rp <rp-slot-number> commit [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Displays verbose information, meaning all information that can be displayed on the console during the process will be displayed.

Examples: In the following example, this command is entered to commit an upgrade:
request platform software package install rp 1 commit
ExtraInfo: This command is entered after the **request platform software package install rp** *rp-slot-number* **file** command is used with the **auto-rollback** *minutes* option to begin an individual sub-package or a consolidated package upgrade. When the **auto-rollback** *minutes* option is used in this context, a rollback timer that cancels the upgrade after the number of specified *minutes* cancels the upgrade if the **request platform software package install rp** *rp-slot-number* **commit** command is not entered to commit the upgrade.If this command is not entered after the **request platform software package install rp** *rp-slot-number* **file** command is used with the **auto-rollback** *minutes* option to upgrade an individual sub-package or a consolidated package and the rollback timer expires, the upgrade does not complete and the router continues running the previous sub-package or consolidated package.

RelatedCmds.description: Upgrades a consolidated package or sub-package.

RelatedCmds.cmd: request platform software package install rollback
RelatedCmds.description: Rolls back a previous software upgrade.
